title: Many Cities Say Yes to Federal Police Help, but No to ‘Occupation’
summary: Some mayors and police chiefs said they would welcome more traditional law enforcement cooperation with federal agents, but see the National Guard as a step too far.

title: Grand Juries in D.C. Reject Wave of Charges Under Trump’s Crackdown
summary: The persistent rejections suggest that the grand jurors may have had enough of prosecutors seeking harsh charges in a highly politicized environment.

title: Chicago Braces for Trump’s Immigration Crackdown
summary: Protesters held demonstrations and city leaders spoke against the prospect of a surge of federal agents.

title: How Trump’s Blunt-Force Diplomacy Is Pushing His Rivals Together
summary: Some of President Trump’s pressure tactics appear to have backfired, sending would-be allies into the embrace of China.

title: In India’s Rebound From Trump Blows, Modi Has No Easy Choices
summary: The unraveling of relations between the United States and India has convinced many Indian officials that the country should return to its difficult balancing act of nonalignment.

title: Trump Says U.S. Military Has ‘Never Fought to Win’ Since World War II
summary: As he signed an order recognizing the Defense Department as the “Department of War,” President Trump said that the country “could have won every war, but we really chose to be very politically correct.”

title: George Mason’s President, Gregory Washington, Will Not Apologize to the Trump Administration
summary: Gregory Washington, George Mason’s first Black president, runs a university that prizes diversity. That has made him a target of the Trump administration.

title: Settlement Talks Stall Between Harvard and the Trump Administration
summary: One major reason is said to be an emerging divide within the administration over whether the current framework is too favorable to Harvard.

title: Thrust Into the Line of Fire, Iranians Worry About What Comes Next
summary: A 12-day war in June upended the shadow war rivalry between Israel and Iran. Some Iranians want to strike back, others want to move on.

title: Inside Iran After the 12-Day War
summary: Following a 12-day war with Israel in July, which resulted in the deaths of over 1,000 civilians and many of Iran’s top nuclear scientists and officials, a New York Times team was granted access to Tehran. Declan Walsh, a Times international correspondent, explains how the conflict has created a widespread sense of uncertainty and flux in the Iranian capital.

title: Israel Targets More Buildings in Gaza City and Warns Residents to Flee
summary: The Israeli military issued evacuation orders for residents in the high-rise towers and urged Palestinians to move to the south of Gaza, as it intensifies its offensive on the city.

title: The Girls Are Screaming
summary: A shriekathon in “John Proctor Is the Villain” is the latest in a wave of young women letting their pipes loose — and exhorting anyone to join in.

title: Immigration Raid on Hyundai-LG Plant in Georgia Rattles South Korea
summary: The shocked but subdued reaction to the arrest of hundreds of Koreans at the site reflected the delicate position of a government engaged in tense trade talks with the Trump administration.

title: How a Top Secret SEAL Team 6 Mission Into North Korea Fell Apart
summary: The 2019 operation, greenlit by President Trump, sought a strategic edge. It left unarmed North Koreans dead.

title: Davey Johnson, Who Managed the Mets to a Memorable Title, Dies at 82
summary: Before his triumph in the 1986 World Series, he had a long playing career and established himself as one of baseball’s brainier and more self-assured characters.

title: Bernie Sanders to Host Zohran Mamdani at Fighting Oligarchy Event in Brooklyn
summary: Mr. Sanders will host the Democratic front-runner for mayor of New York City at a town hall in Brooklyn on Saturday night. The two marched in a Labor Day parade that morning in Manhattan.

title: Adams Insists He’s Running for Mayor Despite Saudi Ambassadorship Talks
summary: The discussions were said to be part of an effort to consolidate opposition to Zohran Mamdani’s campaign for mayor, but appeared to be fading on Friday.

title: Men + Women + Apps = Bad Romance
summary: The two sexes are looking past each other.

title: Three Opinion Writers on Whether Congress Can Rein in Trump
summary: On this week’s round table, the G.O.P’s shutdown spiral.

title: Offer Accepted
summary: We spend a lot of time thinking of reasons we shouldn’t do things. What if we decided to default to yes?

title: Norway’s Navy Gets a Big Boost With U.K. Ship Deal
summary: A plan to buy warships shows how Europe is bolstering defenses amid worries about Russian aggression and President Trump’s isolationist policies, analysts say.

title: Lightning Strikes California With Unusual Frequency This Summer
summary: Weather patterns channeling moisture into the state have led to an abundance of lightning strikes that have ignited hundreds of wildfires.

title: Karina Milei, Argentina’s Mysterious First Sister, Captivates Nation After Audio Leaks
summary: Karina Milei has become a lightning rod for corruption accusations even as her power and the loyalty of her brother, President Javier Milei, remain unwavering.

title: Americans’ Most Valuable Asset Isn’t Stocks or a Home. It’s Social Security.
summary: For the vast majority of people, the stream of promised retirement checks is worth more than anything else, our columnist says.
